Key Match Events: Yuki Kawamura played his second game, but still hasn't scored his first points in the NBA.
Kawamura had a turnover and missed both 3-point attempts in his two minutes against the Magic.
Pre-Game Insights: The Memphis faithful called for Japanese reserve Yuki Kawamura to enter the game.
Memphis coach Taylor Jenkins sent Kawamura to the scorer's table with just over two minutes left.
Post-Match Reflections: Kawamura said it was a special moment and he loves the experience.
He expressed that he could have done more and will keep working hard every day.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kawamura is the second Japanese player in Grizzlies' history, joining Yuta Watanabe.
He played in the Japanese B.League for the past five seasons and was the 2022-23 Most Valuable Player with the Yokohama B-Corsairs.
Others: Ja Morant encouraged Kawamura to shoot the ball and get his name in the paper.
